numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in the acceptance chances.
2. A student can be in the 80th percentile of income.
3. A student can have no legacy status.
4. If a student is in the 80th percentile of income and has no legacy status then the acceptance chance of the student is reduced.
5. A student can be in the 99th percentile of income.
6. If a student is in the 99th percentile of income and has no legacy status then the student is still twice as likely to be accepted as an average student.
7. The grey line represents a value.
8. The grey line dips below the average only between the 75th percentile and the 90th percentile of earnings.
9. Some students have no legacy status.
10. Some students live in families with very high incomes.
11. These students have greater chances of getting into colleges.
12. I wonder why these students have greater chances of getting into colleges.
13. Reputation can be a factor.
14. I ask whether reputation is another factor.
15. Many people live in my community.
16. Many people in my community apply to college.
17. These people must compete with other students.
18. Some students are the child of a former student.
19. If a student is the child of a former student then the student gets a massive boost in admissions.
20. This situation is a major struggle for people in my community.
21. Many people work very hard.
22. Many people try to achieve their dreams.
23. Some people lose to the college system.
24. The headline is: Legacy and Luxury: The Admissions Advantage Unveiled in Elite Colleges.
